fields.headline: Police beat election fraud protesters
fields.bodyText: Thousands of riot police broke up protests in Cairo yesterday, as crowds gathered to support two judges facing a disciplinary committee over their complaints about fraud in last year's parliamentary elections. Security officers attacked demonstrators, dragging some away. Three plainclothes police beat a photographer working for Reuters, confiscating one camera and smashing another, and an al-Jazeera cameraman was badly beaten. Mahmoud Mekky and Hesham Bastawisi, the judges, have refused to attend the hearing, which was adjourned for a week.
